info.title: abas ERP Rest API
info.description: This is the Restful API server for the abas ERP system. You can find out more about abas-ERP at [https://abas-erp.com](https://abas-erp.com).

tags.name: Database Objects
tags.description: The abas ERP Database Object resources.

get.summary: Get the value of a freetext table field.
get.description: Get the complete contents of a freetext table field. Freetext fields have a link with rel "via" that links to here.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The ID of the target client in abas ERP. Freetext fields have a link with rel "via" that links to here.

parameters.name: workingSet
parameters.description: The ID of the working set.

parameters.name: workingSetEditor
parameters.description: The ID of the working set editor.

parameters.name: rowSpec
parameters.description: The table row.

parameters.name: fieldName
parameters.description: The field name.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Operating language according to the table of operating languages in abas ERP

default.description: Complete contents of a freetext header field

put.summary: Set the value of a table field.
put.description: Set the value of a table field. Freetext fields have a link with rel "via" that links to here.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The ID of the target client in abas ERP.

parameters.name: workingSet
parameters.description: The ID of the working set.

parameters.name: workingSetEditor
parameters.description: The ID of the working set editor.

parameters.name: rowSpec
parameters.description: The table row.

parameters.name: fieldName
parameters.description: The field name.

parameters.name: trimValues
parameters.description: Sets the "TRIMVALUES" EDP option. Determines the setting for whether output field contents should be trimmed, i.e leading and following spaces are removed.

parameters.name: disableFOP
parameters.description: Sets the "FOPMODE" EDP option. Enables/Disables the execution of (E)FOPs (corresponds with FOP +/- in abas). For this to work, the user must have the corresponding ERP permissions.

parameters.name: erpFlags
parameters.description:
Sets abas ERP server flags (EDP options TESTFLAGxxx). Note: Don't use this flag without authorization from abas support.
The syntax is a comma-separated list of flag numbers, each prefixed with + or - to enable or disable the flag. For example, "+298,+301,-46"

parameters.name: maxFTextSize
parameters.description: Sets the "FTMODE" EDP option to "TEXT:<length>". Free texts will be output as texts with the specified maximum length. The value must not exceed the hard limit configured in the abas REST API ERP connection config file.

parameters.name: variableLanguage
parameters.description: Sets the "VARLANG" EDP option. Variable names must be specified in this language in all positions.

parameters.name: maxWaitOnLock
parameters.description: Sets the timeout to wait for a lock on an abas ERP record in seconds. A value less than 0 means: wait infinitely.

parameters.name: storeRowMode
parameters.description: Sets the "STOREROWMODE" EDP option for the "STORE" (create or update) edit action. This controls the behavior of the editor regarding the deletion of unchanged rows.

parameters.name: dialogMode
parameters.description:
Sets the "DIALOGMODE" EDP option. The following values are supported: 
* ENABLED: Enable the ERP dialog mode (EDP: DIALOGMODE=1)
* DISABLED: Disable the ERP dialog mode (EDP: DIALOGMODE=0)
* BLOCKING: Enable the blocking dialog mode (EDP: DIALOGMODE=2).

parameters.name: blockingActionTimeout
parameters.description: The timeout (in seconds) of blocking actions. This is only relevant for interactive editing in a working set editor.

parameters.name: enableBlockingActions
parameters.description: Enable blocking actions. This is only relevant for interactive editing in a working set editor. For working set editors, it is true. If the underlying ERP version does not support blocking dialogs, it is set to false. For all other resources, it is disabled

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Operating language according to the table of operating languages in abas ERP

requestBody.description: New value for the free text field.

post.summary: Create a new working set editor.
post.description:
Creates a new uninitialized editor.
This is useful to subscribe to editor events before opening it.
After that it can be opened via the INIT resource, or passed to one of the command resources via the "editorId" query parameter.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The ID of the target client in abas ERP.

parameters.name: workingSet
parameters.description: The ID of the working set.

parameters.name: editorId
parameters.description:
Use this ID for the new editor.
Note This parameter is intended for tests.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Operating language according to the table of operating languages in abas ERP

get.summary: Get a List of all printable layouts and printers for the database record in the working set editor.
get.description:
Get a list of all printable layouts and printers for the dataset in the working set editor. It shows more layouts then in the GUI screen.

The user must have the following ERP permissions to access this resource:

* Permission for type command number "43".

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The ID of the target client in abas ERP.

parameters.name: workingSet
parameters.description: The ID of the working set.

parameters.name: workingSetEditor
parameters.description: The ID of the working set editor.

parameters.name: rowSpec
parameters.description: Context row.

parameters.name: layout
parameters.description: Filter by layout.

parameters.name: printer
parameters.description: Filter by printer.

parameters.name: fileType
parameters.description: Filter by file type.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Operating language according to the table of operating languages in abas ERP

post.summary: Print the database record in the working set editor.
post.description:
Print a database record in the working set editor using default print settings. The specific print settings are controlled with the request body. The response includes a link to the generated file.

The user must have the following ERP permissions to access this resource:

* Permission for type command number "43".

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The ID of the target client in abas ERP.

parameters.name: workingSet
parameters.description: The ID of the working set.

parameters.name: workingSetEditor
parameters.description: The ID of the working set editor.

parameters.name: rowSpec
parameters.description: Context row.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Operating language according to the table of operating languages in abas ERP

requestBody.description: Parameters for the print command.

get.summary: Search for possible values for a reference table field.

parameters.name: dialogMode
parameters.description:
Sets the "DIALOGMODE" EDP option. The following values are supported: 
* ENABLED: Enable the ERP dialog mode (EDP: DIALOGMODE=1)
* DISABLED: Disable the ERP dialog mode (EDP: DIALOGMODE=0)
* BLOCKING: Enable the blocking dialog mode (EDP: DIALOGMODE=2).

parameters.name: blockingActionTimeout
parameters.description: The timeout (in seconds) of blocking actions. This is only relevant for interactive editing in a working set editor.

parameters.name: enableBlockingActions
parameters.description: Enable blocking actions. This is only relevant for interactive editing in a working set editor. For working set editors, it is true. If the underlying ERP version does not support blocking dialogs, it is set to false. For all other resources, it is disabled

parameters.name: enableErpKernelFilter
parameters.description: Use kernel filter that will apply business logic restrictions to the search results. This will slow down the request, but filter out more records.

parameters.name: format
parameters.description: Response format. "SE" for the native search engine response or "ERP" for the normal response format of this Rest API.

parameters.name: mode
parameters.description: Set to "PREFIX" to switch to prefix search.

parameters.name: index
parameters.description: Index number. The default value for this parameter is configured in the search service config file in the "abasconfig" directory.

parameters.name: keywords
parameters.description: If this parameter is true, the full text search service response will be parsed for highlighting information and a list of matching keywords will be created and delivered.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query expression

parameters.name: headFields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of header fields. Use "-" for empty field list and "*" for all fields.

parameters.name: tableFields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of table fields. Use "-" for empty field list and "*" for all fields.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to retrieve. If limit is 0, all objects are returned.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Result offset (for example, for paging). This is the number of items to skip in the result. If the total number of available items exceeds the limit, an offset greater than 0 must be used to iterate over all items.

parameters.name: tableLimit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to retrieve from a table result window. If limit is 0, all items are returned.

parameters.name: tableOffset
parameters.description: Table result offset (for example, for paging). This is the number of items to skip in the table result window. If the total number of available items exceeds the tableLimit, an offset greater than 0 must be used to iterate over all items.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Operating language according to the table of operating languages in abas ERP

parameters.name: tableOffset

parameters.description: Maximum number of items to retrieve from a table result window. If limit is 0, all items are returned.

parameters.name: cn

parameters.name: trimValues

parameters.name: disableFOP
parameters.description: Sets the "FOPMODE" EDP option. Enables/Disables the execution of (E)FOPs (corresponds with FOP +/- in abas). For this to work, the user must have the corresponding ERP permissions.

parameters.name: erpFlags
parameters.description:

parameters.name: variableLanguage

parameters.name: maxWaitOnLock
parameters.description: Sets the timeout to wait for a lock on an abas ERP record in seconds. A value less than 0 means: wait infinitely.

parameters.name: storeRowMode
parameters.description: Sets the "STOREROWMODE" EDP option for the "STORE" (create or update) edit action. This controls the behavior of the editor regarding the deletion of unchanged rows.

parameters.name: trimValues
parameters.description: Sets the "TRIMVALUES" EDP option. Determines the setting for whether output field contents should be trimmed, i.e leading and following spaces are removed.

parameters.name: disableFOP
parameters.description: Sets the "FOPMODE" EDP option. Enables/Disables the execution of (E)FOPs (corresponds with FOP +/- in abas). For this to work, the user must have the corresponding ERP permissions.

parameters.name: erpFlags
parameters.description:
Sets abas ERP server flags (EDP options TESTFLAGxxx). Note: Don't use this flag without authorization from abas support.

parameters.name: variableLanguage
parameters.description: Sets the "VARLANG" EDP option. Variable names must be specified in this language in all positions.

parameters.name: maxWaitOnLock
parameters.description: Sets the timeout to wait for a lock on an abas ERP record in seconds. A value less than 0 means: wait infinitely.

parameters.name: storeRowMode
parameters.description: Sets the "STOREROWMODE" EDP option for the "STORE" (create or update) edit action. This controls the behavior of the editor regarding the deletion of unchanged rows.

parameters.description:

* ENABLED: Enable the ERP dialog mode (EDP: DIALOGMODE=1)

parameters.description: Maximum number of items to retrieve from a table result window. If limit is 0, all items are returned.

post.summary: Use an EDP editor to change a database record.
post.description:
Open an EDP editor in a specified client, apply multiple commands, and optionally save the result.
This can be used to create/update/delete database records, execute infosystems, run type commands, etc. You can find a complete list of the EDP editing actions here .

The editor is opened via the "initAction" property of the post body.
Then all "actions" are applied in order.
If no "closingAction" is defined the editor is canceled.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Result offset (for example, for paging). This is the number of items to skip in the result. If the total number of available items exceeds the limit, an offset greater than 0 must be used to iterate over all items.

parameters.description: Maximum number of items to retrieve. If limit is 0, all objects are returned.

parameters.name: tableLimit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to retrieve from a table result window. If limit is 0, all items are returned.

parameters.description: Sets the "FOPMODE" EDP option. Enables/Disables the execution of (E)FOPs (corresponds with FOP +/- in abas). For this to work, the user must have the corresponding ERP permissions.

parameters.name: erpFlags
parameters.description:
Sets abas ERP server flags (EDP options TESTFLAGxxx). Note: Don't use this flag without authorization from abas support.
The syntax is a comma-separated list of flag numbers, each prefixed with + or - to enable or disable the flag. For example, "+298,+301,-46"

parameters.name: maxFTextSize
parameters.description: Sets the "FTMODE" EDP option to "TEXT:<length>". Free texts will be output as texts with the specified maximum length. The value must not exceed the hard limit configured in the abas REST API ERP connection config file.

parameters.name: variableLanguage
parameters.description: Sets the "VARLANG" EDP option. Variable names must be specified in this language in all positions.

parameters.name: maxWaitOnLock
parameters.description: Sets the timeout to wait for a lock on an abas ERP record in seconds. A value less than 0 means: wait infinitely.

parameters.name: storeRowMode
parameters.description: Sets the "STOREROWMODE" EDP option for the "STORE" (create or update) edit action. This controls the behavior of the editor regarding the deletion of unchanged rows.

parameters.name: dialogMode
parameters.description:
Sets the "DIALOGMODE" EDP option. The following values are supported: 
* ENABLED: Enable the ERP dialog mode (EDP: DIALOGMODE=1)
* DISABLED: Disable the ERP dialog mode (EDP: DIALOGMODE=0)
* BLOCKING: Enable the blocking dialog mode (EDP: DIALOGMODE=2).

parameters.name: blockingActionTimeout
parameters.description: The timeout (in seconds) of blocking actions. This is only relevant for interactive editing in a working set editor.

parameters.name: enableBlockingActions
parameters.description: Enable blocking actions. This is only relevant for interactive editing in a working set editor. For working set editors, it is true. If the underlying ERP version does not support blocking dialogs, it is set to false. For all other resources, it is disabled

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: The abas ERP table (database:group)

parameters.name: criteria
parameters.description: Query string. You can find the syntax information here

parameters.name: headFields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of header fields. Use "-" for empty field list and "*" for all fields.

parameters.name: tableFields
parameters.description: Comma-separated list of table fields. Use "-" for empty field list and "*" for all fields.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Result offset (for example, for paging). This is the number of items to skip in the result. If the total number of available items exceeds the limit, an offset greater than 0 must be used to iterate over all items.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to retrieve. If limit is 0, all objects are returned.

parameters.name: tableOffset
parameters.description: Table result offset (for example, for paging). This is the number of items to skip in the table result window. If the total number of available items exceeds the tableLimit, an offset greater than 0 must be used to iterate over all items.

parameters.name: tableLimit
parameters.description: Maximum number of items to retrieve from a table result window. If limit is 0, all items are returned.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Operating language according to the table of operating languages in abas ERP

parameters.name: configured
parameters.description: Filter by configured property. Set to "true" to only receive results that are configured. Set to "false" for not configured.

parameters.name: singleObject
parameters.description: Filter by single object property. Set to "true" to only receive results that contain a single object (e.g. CompanyData). Set to "false" for multiple objects.

parameters.name: additional
parameters.description: Filter by single additional property. Set to "true" to only receive results from additional tables. Set to "false" for standard tables.

parameters.description: The ID of the target client in abas ERP.

parameters.name: variableLanguage
parameters.description: Sets the "VARLANG" EDP option. Variable names must be specified in this language in all positions.

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: The infosystem workspace

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Operating language according to the table of operating languages in abas ERP

parameters.name: variableLanguage
parameters.description: Sets the "VARLANG" EDP option. Variable names must be specified in this language in all positions.

parameters.name: Accept-Language

get.summary: Metadata of call parameters for an infosystem.
get.description:
List metadata of call parameters that can be used from the infosystem. 

The user must have the following ERP permissions to access this resource:

* Query permission for database "87:9".
* Query permission for database "12:26".
* Query permission for database "65:1".

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The ID of the target client in abas ERP.

parameters.name: workspace
parameters.description: The infosystem workspace

parameters.name: searchWord
parameters.description: The infosystem search word.

parameters.name: table
parameters.description: Filter by table property. Set to "true" to only receive call parameters for rows. Set to "false" for call parameters for header.

parameters.name: custom
parameters.description: Filter by custom property. Set to "true" to only receive custom call parameters. Set to "false" for standard call parameters.

parameters.name: common
parameters.description: Filter by common property. Set to "true" to only receive common call parameters. Set to "false" for call parameters this table only.

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Operating language according to the table of operating languages in abas ERP

get.summary: View an image.
get.description: View an image converted to either JPEG, GIF or PNG. Alternatively the image can be downloaded without any conversions in which case all image formats are supported.

parameters.name: raw
parameters.description: Download the image without any conversion.

parameters.name: clientId
parameters.description: The ID of the target client in abas ERP.

parameters.name: fileName
parameters.description: The name of the image file.

parameters.name: maxWidth
parameters.description: Maximum width of the image. Actual width might be smaller due to actual size, aspect ratio, or "scale" parameter.

parameters.name: maxHeight
parameters.description: Maximum height of the image. Actual height might be smaller due to actual size, aspect ratio, or "scale" parameter.

parameters.name: scale
parameters.description: Scale factor for the image

parameters.name: Accept-Language
parameters.description: Operating language according to the table of operating languages in abas ERP

EnvelopeErpResponseErpAbout.description: Envelope for a REST API response.

ErpAbout.description:
Information about an erp client (mandant).



`erpClientName` contains the value of the environment variable `MANDANT` in abas Essentials.

`erpClientId` contains the value of the environment variable `MNAME` in abas Essentials.

`erpGuiDDEServerName` contains the value of the environment variable `DDESERVERNAME` in abas Essentials.

`erpVersion` contains the value of the edp session option `ABASVERSION`.

`erpVersionNumber` contains the value of the edp session option `ABASVERSNUM`.

`erpVersionName` contains the value of the edp session option `ABASVERSNAME`.

`erpTimeZone` contains the value of the edp session option `TIMEZONE`.

`erpDateTime` contains the value of the edp session option `DATE`.



See [EDP SHO](https://extranet.abas.de/sub_de/help/he/html/300.17.2.3.3.html#300.17.2.3.3.5) for more information about edp session options.
